Seemingly normal people can display extreme cruelty when given a socially acceptable scapegoat to vent their frustrations upon.

Popular sadism is still sadism.

Beware the dark passions of unthinking crowds.

Guard your own moral standards and meet them.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet:
We must sometimes do things that we are not qualified to do. 

Infants are not qualified to walk.

Growing up is a succession of tests we are not qualified to take.

This is what growth demands.

You can make a persuasive case that all your troubles are the fault of others.

You will convince some people.

You might even convince yourself.

Are your troubles now solved?

They make sure there is always a new fire to put out.

They are both fireman and arsonist.

Error may beget prudence.

Hardship can build endurance.

Misfortune will become experience.

Each day calls us to the work of being ourselves.

The hour asks us to meet it, and meet it we must.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet:
When they lose their good sense, keep yours.

When they abandon their morality, keep yours.

Madness in the crowd is not an excuse for personal degeneration.

Be a fortress.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet:
The work of centuries can be torn down in hours.

The destroyers will live and die in the ruins of something they cannot rebuild or replace.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet:
An untruth is most dangerous when it becomes an uncontroversial banality.

We habituate ourselves to the sound of nonsense and cease to notice it.

Fashion takes the place of reason and the truth dies unmourned.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet: The tide of unreason rises.

Embrace the hard questions.

Be wary of the easy answers.

tweet:
Some prefer an endless fight to a win.

How flattering to always be the noble opposition, how free of responsibility.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet:
Those who promote “righteous anger” may get more than they bargain for.

Anger rarely stays righteous for long.

It becomes an end in itself.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet: The virtuous man may not have to stand alone, but he must be willing to.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet:
The value of reading is now as much about the capacity to focus as the content of the book.

Regular reading is a practice that directs our focus towards something specific.

It is a counterpoint to a culture of increasingly fractured attention and compulsive pseudo-multitasking.

You can “get a good education” by giving it to yourself.

Education is something you do, not something that passively happens to you.

Elite colleges sell a brand name and a networking opportunity.

The knowledge itself is in the library and in the device you’re reading this on.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet:
The default manner of engaging with social media leads to an enormous amount of time being wasted thinking about meaningless nonsense.

The micro-outrages, the celebrity gossip planted by PR people, the fake memes that promote Disney+.

Endless noise.

Filter it ruthlessly.

tweet:
We rarely appreciate all that our enemies do for us.

They test us and make us stronger.

They exploit our flaws, motivating us to correct them.

They show us what we do not wish to become.

So many memorable lessons.

What fine teachers our enemies are.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet:
Most people are good when they are among the good.

Observe them in the company of scoundrels and you will find out if they are moral or merely conformist.

YouTube is full of teachers who will happily repeat themselves until you get it.

A rewindable instructor has infinite patience.

One of the great resources of our time.

Good writing is bad writing + a day of revision.

Quality is a process.

Valuable information is increasingly free.

The focus to learn and apply it is increasingly rare.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet:
The ignorant can be instructed.

It is the incurious who are in trouble.

tweet:

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet:
Many people are anxious and inhibited because they walk around with a comment section in their heads.

Famous people are often driven insane by the sense that they can’t possibly manage the opinions of so many.

Social media gives “normal people” this feeling as well.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet:
Pause and ask yourself:

“Does this really need a response?”

Little annoyances come and go.

The irritation fades quickly if it is not indulged.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet: Don't expect insecure people to forgive you for your successes.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet:
We instinctively try to rise to the level of the room we’re in.

We grow quickly when we put ourselves in a room where the expectations have a high floor and a high ceiling.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet: If you can enjoy a laugh at your own expense you are sure to find humor in each day.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet:
Creative work often requires the creation of a problem to fix.

This is why writers emphasize the liberation of messy first drafts.

Our problem-solving skills are activated by the obvious flaws and solutions leap suddenly to mind.

The results may look like pure inspiration.

name: The Stoic Emperor

Do you have too many troubles?

Or are you troubled by too many things?

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet: Meet bad fortune without self-pity and good fortune without foolish excess.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet:
People who spend all day reading texts and Twitter will tell you “I don’t read. I don’t have time.”

You are reading this. You have time.

People read more than ever. They read plenty of marketing emails and angry YouTube comments.

Read something worthwhile.

Read a good book.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet: We shall meet greater and lesser men along our road and we shall learn from all of them.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet:
Think long term.

Execute short term.

Appreciate the present.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet:
Reading offers a kind of telepathy.

It allows thought to flow fairly seamlessly from one mind to another.

Wide reading gives us a sense of not only WHAT others think, but HOW they think.

Reading permits us to commune with the dead and better understand the living.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet:
The internet enables the obnoxious to monetize your reactions to their provocations.

Clickbait starves without clicks.

Withdraw your “engagement” from things you don’t want more of.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet:
It may be wise to choose an excessively charitable interpretation of the other person in a dispute.

Perhaps you misunderstood their intent.

Perhaps you understood their intent perfectly and they will now embrace the more benign position as a way out.

A win either way.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet:
Even Ricky’s most cutting jokes were fairly mild compared to much of public opinion.

The visible surprise and offense on most faces in that room show how insulated most of these people are.

They aren’t used to having to listen to people who aren’t flattering them for access.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet:
Avoidable personal conflicts constantly derail otherwise promising businesses, movements, and marriages.

Broadly well-aligned people should pause and appreciate the rarity of finding others with whom they have so much in common.

If you can... make it work.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet: Error is inevitable. Persisting in it is not.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet:
Definitely.

Essential advice for all the undergraduates packing their essays with ten dollar words they don’t understand.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet:
The real art of communication is not in making yourself impressive, but in making yourself understood.

It is a rarer skill than you might think.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet:
Your time has monetary value to advertisers, influencers, and Netflix.

It should have a deeper value to you.

It is your life.

Don’t give it away too cheaply.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet:
You can always find someone to talk you out of your own best ideas.

Feedback has value, but don’t use it as an excuse for stasis.

Do what you know needs doing.

Make yourself oblivious to irrelevant opinions.

Act.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet:
Try to accept hard truths a little faster than other people do.

It is a great advantage.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet:
Unexamined anxiety can look like a lack of attention span.

People can’t focus when they feel the world is about to eat them.

Thoughts dart from one vague worry to another, like the eyes of a prey animal scanning for wolves.

Calmly examine your veiled fears.

They may diminish.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet:
The limitation of newspaper column space forced writerly discipline. 

Blogs removed that limitation and permitted people to go on as long as they wanted, a freedom that often came at the cost of readability and focus.

Twitter brought back reader friendly concision.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet:
Rapid learning requires a high tolerance for looking stupid.

The path to answers begins with the admission that we don’t know them.

Adopting the appearance of knowledge is a way to impress, but not a way to improve.

Ignorant questions are preferable to premature answers.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet:
You don’t have time to “keep up” with all the irrelevant ephemera that marketers and manipulators want you to respond to.

TV can go unwatched.

Articles can remain unread.

Trends can fade away unnoticed.

Don’t react to things that don’t matter.

Make time for your life.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet:
People who loudly advertise their virtues may be trying to draw the eye away from their otherwise obvious vices.

A magician flourishes with one hand as he works his trick with the other.

Quiet goodness is goodness.

Noisy goodness is theater.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet:
The obedient student seeks the approval of an authority figure.

The ambitious student seeks to become an authority figure.

The genuine student seeks the truth.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet: How often we condemn others for failings we have already forgiven in ourselves.

Doing anything public-facing in the internet age requires the ability to withstand a near-infinite set of hostile reactions.

Growth will convert some and enrage others.

Learn to weight 1000 silent likes over 3 angry comments, or you’ll give up just when you’re getting traction.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet: Belittling others is the lowest use for a good intellect.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet:
Modern tech has lowered the cost of insulting people, but the personal cost of feeling insulted remains as high as ever.

You can’t reform everyone who offends you, but you can manage your own responses.

When the stimulus is digital... assume you’re overreacting.

Stay centered.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet: People speak well of the man who does not speak too much of himself.

name: The Stoic Emperor

The low-level stimulation keeps our anxieties at bay, but it doesn’t address them at the source.

Quiet would force us endure our own company and get to know ourselves.

No wonder we avoid it.

name: The Stoic Emperor

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet:
The calm person makes a choice.

The angry person finds that anger has chosen for them.

Rage robs us of reason and makes us puppets of our lower instincts.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet:
We are asked to believe that the impossible is ordinary and the ordinary is impossible.

Fads and delusions run rampant.

Remember that popular madness is still madness.

Keep your sanity, even when sanity is the minority position.

Don’t follow the crowd over the cliff’s edge.

name: The Stoic Emperor

A man who is original in some areas may be a brilliant eccentric. 

A man who is original in all areas is certainly insane.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet: We have time enough if we claim what time we have.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet: Feeling superior is an ugly indulgence.

Libraries hold priceless records of other people’s mistakes.

We learn from pain, but it doesn’t always have to be our own.

Many cultivate a calculated blandness, a rational response to ambiguous risk.

They know ANY controversy will harm their permanent online reputation.

Free expression is becoming a luxury good that most people feel they can’t afford.

name: The Stoic Emperor

We achieve nothing when we try to do everything at once.

Multitaskers make errors that singletaskers don’t.

Stop. Prioritize. Choose. Execute.

Do one thing well, then another.

They allow busy people to turn their commute into a classroom.

Professional drivers and manual laborers often listen and learn as they work.

Generic drone of radio is replaced by audio of specific interest to the listener.

We can’t hear our own thoughts with so many voices in our heads.

Creation requires elimination.

Make some room for meaningful complexity by reducing meaningless complexity.

Carve out a space for slower, deeper thinking and generative work.

Spend a week writing down everything that bothers you. Outrages in the news, personal slights, daily irritations.

Read it a month later. How many entries feel important now? Probably not many.

Excess reactivity steals happiness and energy.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet: Hatred is briefly energizing but ultimately exhausting.

Taking responsibility for our condition gives us the will to improve it.

It gives us the strength to act.

Everything costs time and attention.

Nothing is free.

Time is not a renewable resource.

Spend it on things that matter.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet:
People are interesting if you allow them to be.

A routine social interaction is only a couple good questions away from something deeply involving.

People reveal their complexity when you give them your full attention.

Your interest gives them permission to be interesting.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet:
Don’t compete with your neighbors.

Compete with your ideals.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet:
The world will not always provide us with the certainties we desire.

We must grow comfortable with ambiguity.

An open question is preferable to a premature false answer.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet:
Self-pity solves nothing.

It is an appealing way to avoid solutions and wallow in an addictive sense of helplessness.

Events will never conform perfectly to our desires.

Life is a teacher.

Bad experiences teach us that we can survive bad experiences.

Move forward.

They find it hard enough to manage the opinions of a few friends & family.

Managing the visible opinions of thousands? Impossible.

Social media made everyone a micro celebrity and sent “social anxiety” through the roof.

name: The Stoic Emperor

Those who want acceptance often seek fame.

Fame means they will constantly hear from people who don’t accept them.

Public attention is no substitute for personal affection.

Popularity attracts resentment like honey attracts flies.

Be careful what you chase.

You might get it.

Pull the trigger yourself.

When actions contradict words, believe the actions.

Behavior reveals what speech conceals.

Great books of centuries past are free online.

Thinkers of today argue publicly on Twitter.

YouTube is a lecture hall that seats millions.

Podcasts are private tutors for the masses.

A golden age for the self-motivated learner.

Anger is not good at telling us the source of the problem.

Anger is very bad at telling us the solution to the problem.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet: Those who exert themselves in times of ease survive in times of struggle.

Fresh knowledge continuously reshapes our sense of the world around us.

Learning keeps the world alive to us, and us alive to the world.

Education doesn’t end in graduation.

It ends in the grave.

Time will turn excuses into regrets.

name: The Stoic Emperor

Don’t squander the present dueling with the shadows of the past.

This moment is alive with possibility.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet:
There is no downside to endurance.

If you can endure more, you can do more.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet:
Simple personal failings bring ruin to the poor and the powerful alike.

Basic mistakes doom lives more often than complex ones.

Watch your demons.

They have a way of sneaking up on you.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet:
All our civilization lies atop an ancient boneyard of struggling ancestors.

How easily the ignorant living denigrate the fading memory of the mighty dead.

We think in their words and live with the hard won rewards of all their striving centuries.

Be worthy of their legacy.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet: Today’s hot pain is tomorrow’s cold wisdom.

You don't have to believe every thought or act on every impulse.

Self-restraint is not self-censorship.

It is not about fear of reprisal.

It is about aligning your actions with your deepest convictions.

name: The Stoic Emperor

If it is false, it has no weight.

If it is true, it is better to know.

Either way, you are unharmed.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet: Fools perform the service of teaching us how to endure fools.

Weaponizing resentment against popular high-status individuals is a great way to steal some status for yourself.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet:
A leader must learn to look people in the eye and say:

"I trust you. I know you'll make it work."

Give them a chance to surprise you. 

They often will.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet:
A smartphone can be a time saver or a time waster.

These devices can double your effectiveness or halve it.

Impulsive use tempts you to trade your time for trifles.

Intentional use allows you more control over your life.

These tools are good servants and bad masters.

name: The Stoic Emperor

Focusing on your relationship with the timeless will make you less vulnerable to the temptations and stresses of the temporary.

People need to ground their lives in something more than the distractions of the day or the chaos of the news cycle.

name: The Stoic Emperor

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet:
Friendships are forged in years and broken in moments.

The impulsive and reactive will set fire to many worthwhile relationships.

A long-lasting friendship offers a deep and singular kind of companionship.

Forgive the little things.

Every day provides a new false emergency.

A stable and centered individual has a real advantage in an environment where overreaction has become the norm.

Make your own moves.

Avoid getting carried away by the passing moods of the crowd.

name: The Stoic Emperor

Everyone knows that being interrupted makes them less effective, but many people are thoughtlessly allowing more and more interruptions from their devices.

A storm of constant notifications is a barrage of low quality “information.”

Harms focus AND peace of mind.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet: We are most easily deceived by that which we most desire.

Most personal progress happens without an audience.

Partisan news outlets distort the world in order to provide the viewer with an appealingly consistent narrative.

Dogmas are reinforced and enemies are engineered.

Events are interpreted and “contextualized” with a moral shading that reliably flatters the target viewer.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet: Wishing you had spent your time differently only wastes more time.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet: Outward action and inner calm.

Life is here today, sun bright and blood hot.

Embrace it.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet:

Creative people should notice and cultivate the state in which they excel.

Crafting the conditions that promote excellence may not feel like important work, but it leads to important work.

Perfect the process.

name: The Stoic Emperor

A darkening hour motivates us to find a source of lasting light.

Catastrophe can introduce us to heroic qualities we did not know we possessed.

Courage and effort will light the dark.

name: The Stoic Emperor

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet:
Hard lessons are hard to forget.

Let hardship be a source of knowledge, not bitterness.

Wisdom is hard-won.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet:
The culture has moods and tempers.

It shifts one way, then the other.

The fashion forward quickly become fashion victims, as trends betray the trendy.

Find a source of stable calm in this environment of noisy uncertainty.

Don’t let the culture’s moods dictate your own.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet:
Old books teach urgent new lessons.

People read more than ever, but mostly low-value material.

Unwanted emails, ragebait articles, insane social media babble... largely worthless ephemera.

Quiet libraries are full of half-forgotten marvels.

The undimmed genius of the ages.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet:
Failure can teach endurance or timidity.

Knowing the taste of failure and risking it anyway... that is courage.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet: The more you know yourself, the more you will forgive others.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet:
Some look for people they can feel superior to.

Others look for people they can learn from.

The first is a path to stagnation.

The second is a path to growth.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet: Fear empty words more than silence.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet:
Distraction is the disease of the moment.

Mobile games, clickbait articles, obnoxiously repetitive pop songs.

Distraction without satisfaction.

Just interesting enough to keep the mind noisy and unfocused. 

A little silence will allow deeper truths to surface.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet: Rise to the level of your ideals, not the average of your environment.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet:
The perfected future never arrives.

Life is full of seemingly endless trouble, and then life ends.

Find peace in the imperfect present.

name: The Stoic Emperor

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet:
Making something often begins with breaking something.

Problem solving comes more naturally than creating greatness out of thin air.

Self evident flaws often spark solutions that wouldn't have presented themselves otherwise.

name: The Stoic Emperor
tweet:
People who successfully insult you take ownership of your time and energy, hijacking your mood and schedule.

“Letting things go” isn’t just about sweet forgiveness.

It’s about conserving your energy and attention for the things that matter.

name: The Stoic Emperor
